event.descr: A coldStart trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, is reinitializing itself and that its configuration may have been altered.
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: coldStart trap received

event.descr:
A linkDown trap signifies that the sending protocol entity recognizes a failure in one of the communication links represented in the agent's configuration. Varbind list: ifIndex -- ifIndex of the interface. ifAdminStatus -- ifAdminStatus of the interface. ifOperStatus -- ifOperStatus of the interface. ifDescr -- ifDescr of the interface. ifType -- ifType, this provides descrimination of interfaces that are tunnels. ifReasonForStatus-ces -- reason for the change in status. ifPhysLocation-ces -- this is the slot number. ifPhysRelPos-ces -- the port number on the board defined in interfacePhysLocation. ifIpAddr-ces -- IP address assigned to the phys port or the local IP address of a tunnel. ifName-ces -- Name of the tunnel or physical interface. ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces -- for non-tunnel interfaces it is zero. sysObjectID -- sysObjectID of the unit. sysName -- sysName of the unit.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

ifAdminStatus %parm[#2]%; up(1) down(2) testing(3)

ifOperStatus %parm[#3]%; up(1) down(2) testing(3)

ifDescr %parm[#4]%;

ifType %parm[#5]%; other(1) regular1822(2) hdh1822(3) ddn-x25(4) rfc877-x25(5) ethernet-csmacd(6) iso88023-csmacd(7) iso88024-tokenBus(8) iso88025-tokenRing(9) iso88026-man(10) starLan(11) proteon-10Mbit(12) proteon-80Mbit(13) hyperchannel(14) fddi(15) lapb(16) sdlc(17) ds1(18) e1(19) basicISDN(20) primaryISDN(21) propPointToPointSerial(22) ppp(23) softwareLoopback(24) eon(25) ethernet-3Mbit(26) nsip(27) slip(28) ultra(29) ds3(30) sip(31) frame-relay(32)

ifReasonForStatus-ces %parm[#6]%; unknown(1) idle-time-out(2) ip-addr-chg(3) no-response(4) user-interaction(5) time-limit(6) testing(7) test-complete-success(8) test-complete-failure(9) link-down(10) link-up(11)

ifPhysLocation-ces %parm[#7]%; motherBoardOrSlot0(1) slot1(2) slot2(3) slot3(4) slot4(5) slot5(6)

ifPhysRelPos-ces %parm[#8]%;

ifIpAddr-ces %parm[#9]%;

ifName-ces %parm[#10]%;

ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces %parm[#11]%;

sysObjectID %parm[#12]%;

sysName %parm[#13]%;
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: linkDown trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% ifAdminStatus=%parm[#2]% ifOperStatus=%parm[#3]% ifDescr=%parm[#4]% ifType=%parm[#5]% ifReasonForStatus-ces=%parm[#6]% ifPhysLocation-ces=%parm[#7]% ifPhysRelPos-ces=%parm[#8]% ifIpAddr-ces=%parm[#9]% ifName-ces=%parm[#10]% ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces=%parm[#11]% sysObjectID=%parm[#12]% sysName=%parm[#13]%

event.descr:
A linkUp trap signifies that the sending protocol entity recognizes that one of the communication links represented in the agent's configuration has come up. Varbind list: ifIndex -- ifIndex of the interface. ifAdminStatus -- ifAdminStatus of the interface. ifOperStatus -- ifOperStatus of the interface. ifDescr -- ifDescr of the interface. ifType -- ifType, this provides descrimination of interfaces that are tunnels. ifReasonForStatus-ces -- reason for the change in status ifPhysLocation-ces -- this is the slot number. ifPhysRelPos-ces -- the port number on the board defined in interfacePhysLocation. ifIpAddr-ces -- IP address assigned to the phys port or the local IP address of a tunnel. ifName-ces -- Name of the tunnel or physical interface. ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces -- for non-tunnel interfaces it is zero. sysObjectID -- sysObjectID of the unit. sysName -- sysName of the unit.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

ifAdminStatus %parm[#2]%; up(1) down(2) testing(3)

ifOperStatus %parm[#3]%; up(1) down(2) testing(3)

ifDescr %parm[#4]%;

ifType %parm[#5]%; other(1) regular1822(2) hdh1822(3) ddn-x25(4) rfc877-x25(5) ethernet-csmacd(6) iso88023-csmacd(7) iso88024-tokenBus(8) iso88025-tokenRing(9) iso88026-man(10) starLan(11) proteon-10Mbit(12) proteon-80Mbit(13) hyperchannel(14) fddi(15) lapb(16) sdlc(17) ds1(18) e1(19) basicISDN(20) primaryISDN(21) propPointToPointSerial(22) ppp(23) softwareLoopback(24) eon(25) ethernet-3Mbit(26) nsip(27) slip(28) ultra(29) ds3(30) sip(31) frame-relay(32)

ifReasonForStatus-ces %parm[#6]%; unknown(1) idle-time-out(2) ip-addr-chg(3) no-response(4) user-interaction(5) time-limit(6) testing(7) test-complete-success(8) test-complete-failure(9) link-down(10) link-up(11)

ifPhysLocation-ces %parm[#7]%; motherBoardOrSlot0(1) slot1(2) slot2(3) slot3(4) slot4(5) slot5(6)

ifPhysRelPos-ces %parm[#8]%;

ifIpAddr-ces %parm[#9]%;

ifName-ces %parm[#10]%;

ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces %parm[#11]%;

sysObjectID %parm[#12]%;

sysName %parm[#13]%;
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: linkUp trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% ifAdminStatus=%parm[#2]% ifOperStatus=%parm[#3]% ifDescr=%parm[#4]% ifType=%parm[#5]% ifReasonForStatus-ces=%parm[#6]% ifPhysLocation-ces=%parm[#7]% ifPhysRelPos-ces=%parm[#8]% ifIpAddr-ces=%parm[#9]% ifName-ces=%parm[#10]% ifTunnelRemoteIpAddr-ces=%parm[#11]% sysObjectID=%parm[#12]% sysName=%parm[#13]%

event.descr:
An authenticationFailure trap signifies that the SNMPv2 entity, acting in an agent role, has received a protocol message that is not properly authenticated. The snmpEnableAuthenTraps object indicates whether this trap will be generated. snmpAuthenOperation-ces identifies the operation( ie. GetRequest, GetNextRequest,... ) was being attempted. snmpAuthenIpAddress-ces identifies the source IP address of the operation. snmpAuthenCommString-ces identifies the community string that was used in the operation.

snmpAuthenOperation-ces %parm[#1]%; getRequest(160) getNextRequest(161) setRequest(163) getBulkRequest(165)

snmpAuthenIpAddress-ces %parm[#2]%;

snmpAuthenCommString-ces %parm[#3]%;

sysObjectID %parm[#4]%;

sysName %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: authenticationFailure trap received snmpAuthenOperation-ces=%parm[#1]% snmpAuthenIpAddress-ces=%parm[#2]% snmpAuthenCommString-ces=%parm[#3]% sysObjectID=%parm[#4]% sysName=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
Status of T1 WAN card(s). Possible Values: For Wanic support: Alert: Invalid Device X Warning: Device WanicX disabled Alert: Device WanicX down Warning: Device WanicX not initialized Warning: Device WanicX PPP negotiating Alert: Device WanicX PPP down Alert: Device WanicX FR no support Alert: Device WanicX Unknown DL For T1: Alert: Invalid Device X Warning: Device LMCDTEX disabled Alert: Device LMCDTEX down Warning: Device LMCDTEX not initialized For CSU/DSU: Alert: Invalid Device X Warning: Device LMCCDX disabled Alert: Device LMCCDX down Warning: Device LMCCDX not initialized

systemDate %parm[#4]%;

systemTime %parm[#5]%;

systemUpTime %parm[#6]%;

ifIndex %parm[#7]%;

ifDescr %parm[#8]%;

event.descr:
Status of hardware accelerator card. Possible Values: Invalid hardware accelerator unit %d; Unknown hardware accelerator unit %d; Healthy: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 1 - ATTACHED; Warning: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 2 - DISABLED; Healthy: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 3 - ACTIVE; Warning: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 4 - RECOVERING; Warning: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 5 - SHUTDOWN; Alert: Bulk Accelerator in slot %d: Unit %d Status 6 - FAILED;

severityLevel %parm[#1]%; alert(1) warning(2) disabled(3) healthy(4) unknown(5)

hwAccelStatus %parm[#2]%;

systemName %parm[#3]%;

systemDate %parm[#4]%;

systemTime %parm[#5]%;

systemUpTime %parm[#6]%;
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: hwAccelTrap trap received severityLevel=%parm[#1]% hwAccelStatus=%parm[#2]% systemName=%parm[#3]% systemDate=%parm[#4]% systemTime=%parm[#5]% systemUpTime=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
Status of V.90 Interface card Possible Values: Please note that X corresponds to the unit number of the card. Alert: V.90 Invalid index X Disabled: Device IntModem-X disabled Healthy: Device IntModem-X: PPP is UP. Alert: Device IntModem-X down Warning: Device IntModem-X not initialized Alert: Device IntModem-X: Call is UP. Internal Error. Warning: Device IntModem-X is Down. Last dial-out attempt FAILED. Healthy: Device IntModem-X is Down (No Active calls) Warning: Device IntModem-X is in an UNKNOWN state

event.descr:
Status of V.90 Interface card Possible Values: Please note that X corresponds to the unit number of the card. Alert: BRI Invalid index X Alert: Device BRI-X not Responding. Needs Host Reboot. Disabled: Device BRI-X disabled Alert: Device BRI-X down Warning: Device BRI-X not initialized Healthy: Device BRI-X: PPP is UP. Alert: Device BRI-X: Call is UP. Internal Error. Warning: Device BRI-X is Down. Last dial-out attempt FAILED. Healthy: Device BRI-X is Down (No Active calls) Alert: Device BRI-X is in an UNKNOWN state

event.descr:
Status of Serial (COM) port/interface Possible Values: Please note that X corresponds to the unit number of the serial interface Alert: COM port Invalid index X Healthy: Device COMX is set for Serial Menu. Disabled: Device COMX disabled Warning: Device COMX not initialized Healthy: Device COMX: PPP is UP. Alert: Device COMX: Call is UP. Internal Error. Warning: Device COMX is Down. Last dial-out attempt FAILED. Healthy: Device COMX is Down (No Active calls) Alert: Device COMX is in an UNKNOWN state

event.descr:
An event sent at the user's request to signal that a rule has been matched. firewallPolicyType-ces -- Policy type. firewallRuleType-ces -- Type of rule that triggered this event. firewallRuleNumber-ces -- Number of the rule that triggered this event. ifIndex -- ifIndex is the index into the ifTable for port that received the packet. ifName-ces -- The name of the interface, same as ifName. firewallSrcAddr-ces -- Source IP address of the packet. firewallSrcPort-ces -- Source port address of the packet. firewallDestAddr-ces -- Destination IP address of the packet. firewallDestPort-ces -- Destination port of the packet. firewallProtocolID-ces -- The value of the protocol field in the IP header. firewallRuleAction-ces -- Action defined for the triggered rule.

firewallPolicyType-ces %parm[#1]%; firewall(1) nat(2)

firewallRuleType-ces %parm[#2]%; over-ride(1) sourceInterface(2) destinationInterface(3) default(4)

firewallRuleNumber-ces %parm[#3]%;

ifIndex %parm[#4]%;

ifName-ces %parm[#5]%;

firewallSrcAddr-ces %parm[#6]%;

firewallSrcPort-ces %parm[#7]%;

firewallDestAddr-ces %parm[#8]%;

firewallDestPort-ces %parm[#9]%;

firewallProtocolID-ces %parm[#10]%;

firewallRuleAction-ces %parm[#11]%; unknown(1) allow(2) reject(3) drop(4)

sysObjectID %parm[#12]%;

sysName %parm[#13]%;
event.logmsg: NORTEL Event: firewallRuleTriggeredTrap trap received firewallPolicyType-ces=%parm[#1]% firewallRuleType-ces=%parm[#2]% firewallRuleNumber-ces=%parm[#3]% ifIndex=%parm[#4]% ifName-ces=%parm[#5]% firewallSrcAddr-ces=%parm[#6]% firewallSrcPort-ces=%parm[#7]% firewallDestAddr-ces=%parm[#8]% firewallDestPort-ces=%parm[#9]% firewallProtocolID-ces=%parm[#10]% firewallRuleAction-ces=%parm[#11]% sysObjectID=%parm[#12]% sysName=%parm[#13]%
